item.title: Report E-2024050281
item.description:
Report E-2024050281

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of pine oil was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately one-quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ Environmental (ES+) to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel deployed degreaser to the UN1272-impacted trailer and placed absorbent pads to the affected area. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged product was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon drum

item.title: Report E-2024050232
item.description:
Report E-2024050232

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty (50) gallons of material released from two (2) 50-gallon metal drums. The released material impacted the other freight in the trailer due to vehicle accident that filled the trailer. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the released material and containerized the waste. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
